meanings.sent1: The mauts gathered around the tree.
meanings.sent2: I saw many mauts playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mauts seemed to be having a picnic under the sun.
meanings.sent4: The mauts swarmed together like a flock of birds.
meanings.sent5: The colorful mauts danced in the meadow.

meanings.definition: Mauts (verb): third person singular present of maut
meanings.sent1: She mauts every morning before school.
meanings.sent2: He mauts while walking to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat mauts softly as it naps in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The wind mauts through the leaves of the trees.
meanings.sent5: The kettle mauts as it boils water for tea.

meanings.sent1: This flower is mauts than the one next to it.
meanings.sent2: The sky looks mauts today than yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so delicious, it made everything else seem mauts.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was mauts than the sound of bells.
meanings.sent5: The mountain appeared mauts as the sun set behind it.
